faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: This course will introduce several techniques for  modeling an enterprise as a system functioning in the dynamic business environment. The techniques  include well-established modelling methods and tools, such Viable System Model and  ArchiMate, as well as techniques coming from academic world. In order to develop a mastery of these techniques, the students will design enterprise models based on a simulated but realistic business case.
description.et: Sellel kursusel tutvustatakse mitmeid ettevõtte modelleerimise tehnikaid, mis võimaldavad vaadelda ettevõtet kui süsteemi, mis toimib dünaamilises ärikeskkonnas. Kursusel õpetatakse nii praktikas laialt kasutusel tehnikaid nagu Viable System Model ja   ArchiMate kui ka neid, mis tulenevad akadeemilisest maailmast. Tudengid saavad mudelite disainimist proovida ja oskuseid arendada ärikaasuses, mis püüab simuleerida reaalset elulist situatsiooni.

objectives.en: The objectives of this course are to get acquainted with a view on enterprise as a system functioning in the dynamic business environment; basic concepts and principles of  modeling this system using different enterprise modeling techniques and usage of the enterprise models in the field of business and IT development.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgid on oskus vaadelda ettevõtet kui süsteemi mis toimib dünaamilises ärikeskkonnas, arusaam baaskontseptsioonidest ja printsiipidest, et modelleerida seda süsteemi kasutades ettevõtte modelleerimise tehnikaid ning oskus kasutada ettevõtte modelleerimise tehnikaid äri ja IT arendamiseks

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of this course, you will be able to:
Investigate an enterprise as a system functioning in the dynamic business environment
learning_outcomes.et: Vaadelda ettevõtet kui süsteemi mis toimib dünaamilises ärikeskkonnas

learning_outcomes.en: Build enterprise models of an organization using different enterprise modeling techniques
learning_outcomes.et: Ehitada ettevõtte mudeleid, kasutades erinevaid ettevõtte modelleerimise tehnikaid

learning_outcomes.en: Identify a suitable enterprise modeling technique or a combination of techniques to address a given business/technical task or problem task or problem;
learning_outcomes.et: Määratleda konkreetse ettevõtte ülesande või probleemi lahendamiseks sobiv ettevõtte modelleerimise tehnika või tehnikate kombinatsioon

learning_outcomes.en: Use enterprise modeling tools, where appropriate.

independent_work.et: Independent work consists of building enterprise models for the given business case - mini-project. There will be three separate assignments/phases  - each related to a specific modeling technique. The detailed instructions will be posted in the course website in connection to the study of each technique.

description.et:
A project (50 points) which consists of:
- Three intermediate submissions to be completed throughout the semester, totaling 30 points.
- An oral presentation of the whole assignment during the last interactive session of the semester + serving as an opponent for another project group presentation : 20 points

A final written exam (50) points
The resulting grade (out of 100) will be mapped to a grade between A and F using the standard University scale (50 or less: F, 51-60: E, 61-70: D, 71-80: C, 81-90: B, 91-100: A).

grade_preconditions.et:
Home work: there will be a mini-project with three "checkpoint" submissions and a final presentation of a project report. The project will be completed in small groups. The size depends on the number of course participants. Homework is assessed based on a points system. 

Examination: there will be a written examination at the end of the course, also assessed using a scale.

grade_evaluation.et: A student must score at least 25 points in the homeworks to take the exam.

debt_elimination.et:
Late submissions of homeworks are not allowed unless you ask permission from the lecturer beforehand and the lecturer accepts your justification for submitting late. In any case, the submission should not be delayed by more than 48 hours (unless the reason for the delay is very serious)

You will have a chance to do a retake exam if you fail in the first exam.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

topic.et: 2. Enterprise as a connected network as activities - Fractal Enterprise Model (FEM). Introduction
3. Enterprise as a connected network as activities - FEM. Practice
4. Achieving viability in the constantly changing business environment - Viable System Model (VSM). Introduction
5. Achieving viability in the constantly changing business environment - Viable System Model (VSM). Practice
6. Providing relevant IT support - ArchiMate. Introduction
7. Providing relevant IT support – ArchiMate. Practice
